Parameters: boolean: True if this is a self-change notification.
onChange(boolean).Description: This method is called when a content change occurs. Subclasses should override this method to handle content changes.
onChange(boolean).history: Added in API level 11 Deprecated in API level 28

Returns: True if self-change notifications should be delivered to the observer.
deliverSelfNotifications().Description: Returns true if this observer is interested receiving self-change notifications. Subclasses should override this method to indicate whether the observer is interested in receiving notifications for changes that it made to the content itself.
deliverSelfNotifications().history: Added in API level 11 Deprecated in API level 28

ClassDesc: Use https:##developer#android#com@B_android#support#v4#content#Loader#ForceLoadContentObserver_E@ An implementation of a ContentObserver that takes care of connecting it to the Loader to have the loader re-load its data when the observer is told it has changed. You do not normally need to use this yourself; it is used for you by @B_android#content#CursorLoader_E@ to take care of executing an update when the cursor's backing data changes.
